apiDescription: The Lob API is organized around REST. Our API is designed to have predictable, resource-oriented URLs and uses HTTP response codes to indicate any API errors.
metaDescription: Lob provides a suite of APIs to deliver mail, including address verification, mail tracking, and more. Our print & mail API is used by companies large and small to send postcards, letters, and checks.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many results to return.

parameters.name: before/after
parameters.description: `before` and `after` are both optional but only one of them can be in the query at a time.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Request that the response include the total count by specifying `include=["total_count"]`.

parameters.name: dateCreated
parameters.description: Filter by date created. Accepted formats are ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Filter by metadata key-value pair`.

responses.description: Lob uses RESTful HTTP response codes to indicate success or failure of an API request. In general, 2xx indicates success, 4xx indicate an input error, and 5xx indicates an error on Lob's end.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: An integer that designates the offset at which to begin returning results. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Request that the response include the total count by specifying `include=["total_count"]`.

parameters.name: dateCreated
parameters.description: Filter by date created. Accepted formats are ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: dateModified
parameters.description: Filter by date modified. Accepted formats are ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts items by ascending or descending dates. Use either `date_created` or `date_modified`, not both.

parameters.name: case
parameters.description: Casing of the verified address. Possible values are `upper` and `proper` for uppercased (e.g. "PO BOX") and proper-cased (e.g. "PO Box"), respectively. Only affects `recipient`, `primary_line`, `secondary_line`, `urbanization`, and `last_line`. Default casing is `upper`.

parameters.name: xLangOutput
parameters.description:
* `native` - Translate response to the native language of the country in the request
* `match` - match the response to the language in the request

Default response is in English.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: How many results to return.

parameters.name: before/after
parameters.description: `before` and `after` are both optional but only one of them can be in the query at a time.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Request that the response include the total count by specifying `include=["total_count"]`.

parameters.name: dateCreated
parameters.description: Filter by date created. Accepted formats are ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Filter by metadata key-value pair`.

parameters.name: scheduled
parameters.description:
* `true` - only return orders (past or future) where `send_date` is
greater than `date_created`
* `false` - only return orders where `send_date` is equal to `date_created`

parameters.name: sendDate
parameters.description: Filter by ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: mailType
parameters.description: A string designating the mail postage type: * `usps_first_class` - (default) * `usps_standard` - a cheaper option which is less predictable and takes longer to deliver. `usps_standard` cannot be used with `4x6` postcards or for any postcards sent outside of the United States.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts items by ascending or descending dates. Use either `date_created` or `send_date`, not both.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
A string describing the render status:
* `processed` - the rendering process is currently underway.
* `rendered` - the rendering process has completed successfully.
* `failed` - the rendering process has failed.

responses.description: Lob uses RESTful HTTP response codes to indicate success or failure of an API request. In general, 2xx indicates success, 4xx indicate an input error, and 5xx indicates an error on Lob's end.

parameters.description: A string of no longer than 256 characters that uniquely identifies this resource. For more help integrating idempotency keys, refer to our implementation guide.

parameters.description: Filters resources created by the provided campaign id, prefixed with `cmp_`.

parameters.description:
A string describing the render status:
* `processed` - the rendering process is currently underway.
* `rendered` - the rendering process has completed successfully.
* `failed` - the rendering process has failed.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Set to `true` to return only color letters. Set to `false` to return only black & white letters.

parameters.name: scheduled
parameters.description:
* `true` - only return orders (past or future) where `send_date` is
greater than `date_created`
* `false` - only return orders where `send_date` is equal to `date_created`

parameters.name: sendDate
parameters.description: Filter by ISO-8601 date or datetime, e.g. `{ "gt": "2012-01-01", "lt": "2012-01-31T12:34:56Z" }` where `gt` is >, `lt` is <, `gte` is ≥, and `lte` is ≤.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sorts items by ascending or descending dates. Use either `date_created` or `send_date`, not both.

parameters.description: Filters resources created by the provided campaign id, prefixed with `cmp_`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
A string describing the render status:
* `processed` - the rendering process is currently underway.
* `rendered` - the rendering process has completed successfully.
* `failed` - the rendering process has failed.

responses.description: Lob uses RESTful HTTP response codes to indicate success or failure of an API request. In general, 2xx indicates success, 4xx indicate an input error, and 5xx indicates an error on Lob's end.

parameters.name: case
parameters.description: Casing of the verified address. Possible values are `upper` and `proper` for uppercased (e.g. "PO BOX") and proper-cased (e.g. "PO Box"), respectively. Only affects `primary_line`, `city`, and `state`. Default casing is `upper`.

parameters.name: validAddresses
parameters.description: Possible values are `true` and `false`. If false, not all of the suggestions in the response will be valid addresses; they'll need to be verified in order to determine the deliverability. The valid_addresses flag will greatly reduce the number of keystrokes needed before reaching an intended address.

responses.description: Lob uses RESTful HTTP response codes to indicate success or failure of an API request. In general, 2xx indicates success, 4xx indicate an input error, and 5xx indicates an error on Lob's end.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Determines the number of locations returned. Possible values are between 1 and 50 and any number higher will be rounded down to 50. Default size is a list of 5 reverse geocoded locations.
